--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "Shigeki Miyake-Stoner" <shigekims@c...> wrote:
> After splitting, they are both the same as the host.  (stat wise and game
> mechanics wise, and theoretically.)  Studied mitosis :) ?

I remember mitosis, but that's not what happens.
 
> Like in the first slime battle in the original campaign, if gurgle splits,
> either half of gurgle that you kill first announces ENEMY DEATH GURGLE
> KILLED.

I start with a slime called "Revenue".  After it repeatedly splits, eventually slimes with no name will show up.  Hypothetically,
all slimes can from "Revenue" so all slimes should have a name, but that doesn't happen.

My question is when and why that happens.
